body:
Hi @murilommen Thanks for reporting this issue. I'm trying to reproduce the issue, but `mlflow models build-docker` works fine in my environment. Just to confirm, are you using Docker BuildKit (the build log format indicates you are)?

```
>>> export DOCKER_BUILDKIT=1
>>> mlflow models build-docker -m 'runs:/deea0f09c0054316b0cbc259bf313fc4/model' -n my-mlflow-image
...
#1 [internal] load .dockerignore
#1 transferring context: 2B done
#1 DONE 0.0s

#2 [internal] load build definition from Dockerfile
#2 transferring dockerfile: 1.44kB done
#2 DONE 0.0s

#3 [internal] load metadata for docker.io/library/ubuntu:18.04
#3 DONE 0.0s

#4 [1/13] FROM docker.io/library/ubuntu:18.04
#15 DONE 0.0s

#5 [2/13] RUN apt-get -y update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommen...
#5 DONE 130.5s

#6 [3/13] RUN curl -L https://repo.anaconda.com/miniconda/Miniconda3-latest...
#6 DONE 28.9s

#7 [4/13] RUN bash ./miniconda.sh -b -p /miniconda; rm ./miniconda.sh;
#7 DONE 9.5s

#8 [5/13] WORKDIR /opt/mlflow
#8 DONE 0.0s

#9 [6/13] RUN which pip
#9 0.177 /miniconda/bin/pip  # I added this line to identify the localtion of pip

...
```

`pip: not found` indicates that this line doesn't seem to work and `/miniconda/bin` is not added to `PATH`:

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/b125aae1aea5c880e8b2c052222de4a35d8fa787/mlflow/models/docker_utils.py#L34

or something went wrong at this line:

https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/b125aae1aea5c880e8b2c052222de4a35d8fa787/mlflow/models/docker_utils.py#L33

This line succeeds as long as the last command (`rm ./miniconda.sh`) succeeds. If the first (`bash ./miniconda.sh -b -p /miniconda`) command fails, `pip` may not be available. Investigating what's happening in this line might give us some hints.

Hi @harupy thanks for the insights! 
I wasn't explicitly declaring the Docker BuildKit, but perhaps it was already running with it 😄 

I've modified the `docker_builder.py` using `&&` instead of the semi-colon as your PR resolves to, but it still returned me an error when building anaconda (`bash ./miniconda.sh`), which led me to thinking this is an issue for later macbooks with the M1 chip (my case), since there is no anaconda for the ARM64 architecture yet (that I'm aware of).

Interestingly enough, when modifying the `docker_utils.py` to this:
```python
proc = Popen(
            ["docker", "build", "-t", image_name, "-f", "Dockerfile", "." , "--platform=linux/amd64"],
```
It has successfully installed the necessary dependencies! 

Thanks again for the help here, I can open a PR to enforce this behavior if you think it is a good idea.

Thanks for the investigation! I tried the miniconda installation on my M1 MacBook Pro and got the following error:

```
 > [4/4] RUN bash ./miniconda.sh -b -p /miniconda:                                                                                                                                   
#7 0.159 PREFIX=/miniconda                                                                                                                                                           
#7 0.403 Unpacking payload ...                                                                                                                                                       
#7 0.404 /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2: No such file or directory
#7 0.406 /lib64/ld-linux-x86-64.so.2: No such file or directory
```

Did you get the same error?

Confirmed `Miniconda3-latest-Linux-aarch64.sh` works:

```dockerfile
FROM ubuntu:18.04
RUN apt-get -y update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends curl ca-certificates
RUN curl -L https://repo.anaconda.com/miniconda/Miniconda3-latest-Linux-aarch64.sh >> miniconda.sh

RUN bash ./miniconda.sh -b -p /miniconda
ENV PATH="/miniconda/bin:$PATH"
```

```
% docker build -t issue-4561 .
[+] Building 1.0s (8/8) FINISHED                                                                                                                                                     
 => [internal] load build definition from Dockerfile                                                                                                                            0.0s
 => => transferring dockerfile: 324B                                                                                                                                            0.0s
 => [internal] load .dockerignore                                                                                                                                               0.0s
 => => transferring context: 2B                                                                                                                                                 0.0s
 => [internal] load metadata for docker.io/library/ubuntu:18.04                                                                                                                 0.9s
 => [1/4] FROM docker.io/library/ubuntu:18.04@sha256:3b8692dc4474d4f6043fae285676699361792ce1828e22b1b57367b5c05457e3                                                           0.0s
 => CACHED [2/4] RUN apt-get -y update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends curl ca-certificates                                                                       0.0s
 => CACHED [3/4] RUN curl -L https://repo.anaconda.com/miniconda/Miniconda3-latest-Linux-aarch64.sh >> miniconda.sh                                                             0.0s
 => CACHED [4/4] RUN bash ./miniconda.sh -b -p /miniconda                                                                                                                       0.0s
 => exporting to image                                                                                                                                                          0.0s
 => => exporting layers                                                                                                                                                         0.0s
 => => writing image sha256:befce800f11447794371eced6618eae6fc39f65db1ababb0c82cdaea6c7c8f6e                                                                                    0.0s
 => => naming to docker.io/library/issue-4561                                                                                                                                   0.0s
                                                                                                                                                                                     
% docker run issue-4561 pip

Usage:   
  pip <command> [options]
...
```
@harupy precisely! and that is where I had to change the `Popen` bit to include the `--platform=linux/amd64`
maybe too obvious, but you will have to clear your builder cache in case you retry this

You're right. Tried the build with `--no-cache`:

```
% docker build -t issue-4561 --no-cache  .
[+] Building 35.8s (9/9) FINISHED                                                                                                                                                    
 => [internal] load build definition from Dockerfile                                                                                                                            0.0s
 => => transferring dockerfile: 324B                                                                                                                                            0.0s
 => [internal] load .dockerignore                                                                                                                                               0.0s
 => => transferring context: 2B                                                                                                                                                 0.0s
 => [internal] load metadata for docker.io/library/ubuntu:18.04                                                                                                                 2.1s
 => [auth] library/ubuntu:pull token for registry-1.docker.io                                                                                                                   0.0s
 => CACHED [1/4] FROM docker.io/library/ubuntu:18.04@sha256:3b8692dc4474d4f6043fae285676699361792ce1828e22b1b57367b5c05457e3                                                    0.0s
 => [2/4] RUN apt-get -y update && apt-get install -y --no-install-recommends curl ca-certificates                                                                             11.1s
 => [3/4] RUN curl -L https://repo.anaconda.com/miniconda/Miniconda3-latest-Linux-aarch64.sh >> miniconda.sh                                                                   10.5s
 => [4/4] RUN bash ./miniconda.sh -b -p /miniconda                                                                                                                             10.2s 
 => exporting to image                                                                                                                                                          1.7s 
 => => exporting layers                                                                                                                                                         1.7s 
 => => writing image sha256:fead531d9add352f4c47574b3bb12c2ed1f7e309b70a428ca39d7adee4a9420f                                                                                    0.0s 
 => => naming to docker.io/library/issue-4561   
```
@murilommen Does `Miniconda3-latest-Linux-aarch64.sh` also work in your environment?

It looks like we have two approaches to fix this issue:

1. Use `--platform=linux/amd64` option when building an image.
2. Use `Miniconda3-latest-Linux-aarch64.sh` if the `arch` command returns `aarch64`.
@harupy Gonna try this later on today an i'll let you know. Thanks again!
@harupy sorry for the long delay, but I just wanted to know: should we close this or open a PR to explicitly inform the platform/Miniconda version?
